newsitem.title: ESTONIA: TALLINN WANTS TO SELL 25 PCT OF TALLINN WATER.
newsitem.headline: TALLINN WANTS TO SELL 25 PCT OF TALLINN WATER.

text.p: The Tallinn city government on Friday decided to propose to council to sell only 25 percent of Tallinn Water and Sewage Company instead of an earlier decision on a 66 percent sell-off.
"Sixty-six percent would not have passed the council," Ants Leemets, the city's vice mayor, told a news conference.
Leemets added that 25 percent is the minimum rate to get its shares listed on the Tallinn bourse.
The Tallinn city government will propose to council to reorganise Tallinn Water and Sewage company into a joint-stock company with a share capital of 850 million kroons, he said.
Leemets said the company has a good bourse prospects.
"It is relatively large, relatively stable and successful," Leemets said.
